fog.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: cloudy air near the ground which is difficult to see through
fog.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: It will be a cold night, and there may be fog patches.
A blanket of fog covered the fields.
The fog lifted  (=disappeared) in the afternoon.
We got lost in the thick fog.
fog.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: a state in which you feel confused and cannot think clearly
fog.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: My mind was in a fog.
fog.translation[0].note_box[0].sections[: The two lorries collided in heavy fog.
Flights were cancelled due to freezing fog.
She could not see through the swirling fog.
Mist and patchy fog will form tonight.
Rain was forecast, along with hill fog.
The mountains were covered in fog.
The streets of London were shrouded in fog.
Day after day the fog came down.
The fog rolled in from the ocean.
He sat and waited for the fog to lift.
A blanket of fog lay over the town.
As we approached the coast, we ran into a dense bank of fog.
Patches of fog are expected later today.
fog.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: if something made of glass fogs or becomes fogged, it becomes covered in small drops of water that make it difficult to see through
